>>34034631
You literally just choose it when you get to heaven. A life does not have to be about muh learning or muh challenge, it can be easy street for fun too. Like the life of a 10/10 healthy, smart woman born into a rich family with great parents and real friends.

And NDErs say we can do this if we want, unlimited times. And here is a very persuasive argument for why NDEs are real:

https://youtu.be/U00ibBGZp7o

It emphasizes that NDErs are representative of the population as a whole, and when people go deep into the NDE, they all become convinced. As this article points out:

https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/blog/mysteries-consciousness/202204/does-afterlife-obviously-exist

>"Among those with the deepest experiences 100 percent came away agreeing with the statement, "An afterlife definitely exists"."

Since NDErs are representative of the population as a whole, and they are all convinced, then 100% of the population become convinced that there is an afterlife when they have a sufficiently deep NDE themselves. When you dream and wake up, you instantly realize that life is more real than your dreams. When you have an NDE, the same thing is happening, but on a higher level, as you immediately realize that life is the deep dream and the NDE world is the undeniably real world by comparison.

Or as one person quoted in pic related summarized their NDE:

>"As my soul left my body, I found myself floating in a swirling ocean of multi-colored light. At the end, I could see and feel an even brighter light pulling me toward it, and as it shined on me, I felt indescribable happiness. I remembered everything about eternity - knowing, that we had always existed, and that all of us are family. Then old friends and loved ones surrounded me, and I knew without a doubt I was home, and that I was so loved."

Needless to say, even ultraskeptical neuroscientists are convinced by really deep NDEs.

>Crowley arrived for a whole weekend and spent the time like any other visitor to the Prieure; being shown the grounds and the activities in progress, listening to Gurdjieff’s music and his oracular conversation. Apart from some circumspection, Gurdjieff treated him like any other guest until the evening of his departure. After dinner on Sunday night, Gurdjieff led the way out of the dining room with Crowley, followed by the body of pupils who had also been at the meal. Crowley made his way toward the door and turned to take his leave of Gurdjieff, who by this time was some way up the stairs to the second floor. “Mister, you go?” Gurdjieff inquired. Crowley assented. “You have been guest?” – a fact which the visitor could hardly deny. “Now you go, you are no longer guest?” Crowley – no doubt wondering whether his host had lost his grip on reality and was wandering in a semantic wilderness – humored his mood by indicating that he was on his way back to Paris. But Gurdjieff, having made the point that he was not violating the canons of hospitality, changed on the instant into the embodiment of righteous anger. “You filthy,” he stormed, “you dirty inside! Never again you set foot in my house!” From his vantage point on the stairs, he worked himself up into a rage which quite transfixed his watching pupils. Crowley was stigmatized as the sewer of creation was taken apart and trodden into the mire. Finally, he was banished in the style of East Lynne by a Gurdjieff in fine histrionic form. Whitefaced and shaking, the Great Beast crept back to Paris with his tail between his legs.

based Gurdjieff

It'll come to you if it comes to you. Trying to force it or find it is a fool's game. Sometimes you'll just run into something inexplicable or supernatural, or perhaps you won't. Like, imagine it like meeting a deformed person while out for a walk, you see them, pass them by and they're gone. That is what my experiences with the unexplained have been like, Strangeness briefly appearing, catching my attention and vanishing. It isn't life changing like people make it out to be, it just happens occasionally. Maybe it hasn't been cause I don't seek it out. Dunno. Some of it has been real spooky, as short as the encounters have been. Don't think I could handle any experience of that kind that lasted more than a few moments, not sure about you.

But, to actually answer your question and not ramble like a fool, I only once and accidentally got the attention of something instead of just running into it. And that was when, trying to sleep, I began to tell myself a story of encountering an entity of demonic nature, and then for two nights after, had something fucking with me as I tried to sleep, breathing and sighing in my ear, stroking my cheek.

Then it fucked off. Think it just wanted to send a message or troll me. Dunno. Haven't done it since because I was frozen stiff with terror those two nights

I have a few theories of why it happens:
1. The human brain is lazy, we subconsciously categorize everything on a daily basis, but we won't have an individual folder on our heads for each person so we tend to make forced associations. The older we get and the more faces we see things can oly get worse. With internet and social media we're constantly looking at new people and our brains can't deal with that.
2. Apathy, on the same note as the previous point we don't care enough about other people to note their unique facial characteristics. This gets worse the people we meet.
3. Race-mixing/globalisation, people from all over the world will start sharing more and more diverse ethnic characteristics.

The NAC Protocol (Updated December, 2022)

Morning

1200mg NAC
Oregano Oil (min. 40mg Carvacrol)
Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

Night

600mg NAC
Oregano Oil (min. 40mg Carvacrol)
Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

Continue daily for a minimum of two months and count out 3 weeks with no die off symptoms prior to moving to the next step.

Maintenance Protocol
__________

Morning

600mg NAC
500mg Slo Niacin (nicotinic acid)
100mg Pterostilbene
Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

Night

500mg Slo Niacin
100mg Pterostilbene
Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

After every 3 weeks on the maintenance protocol, take 1 week off. Continue to use black seed oil during the off cycle.

Fungal die off symptoms may include :

>Tiredness, exhaustion, muscle soreness, increased chest or nasal discharge, cold or flu like symptoms, cold sores, headaches, rash, acne, irritability, change in stool frequency, volume or color; increased urination, bloated stomach, cramps, increased gas.

OREGANO DOSING GUIDE

For each morning and night dose you need a minimum of 40mg Carvacrol. Do not buy a product unless it is listed. Most products are steam distilled but you will want to confirm that.

If your chosen oregano oil contains a higher amount of carvacrol (60mg+ per cap) you'll want to start with 1 cap morning, 1 cap night. If each cap contains less than 40mg, take 2 morning 2 night.

posts.name: Space Cowboy
posts.com:
NAC, Oregano Oil and Black Seed Oil have all been proven safe in clinical studies.

NAC has shown to be safe in human trials, even in high doses.

https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/33326056/

Oregano was tested in human clinical trials (both Phase I & II) and found to be safe and non-toxic even at high doses.

See Section 4.1 Safety & Toxicty

https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1002/fsn3.2994

See also a 2 month clinical trial on asthmatics.

https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1002/ptr.5967

Black Seed Oil and it's primary active Thymoquinone. See:

https://brieflands.com/articles/semj-76453.html

Orchestrated fear mongering over the extraction process making the compounds is unfounded.

We recommend cold pressed black seed oil, which uses no chemical solvents or heat processing.

https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Vasfiye-Ozyurt/publication/329993761_Cold_press_in_oil_extraction_A_review/links/5c61d58792851c48a9cd3e63/Cold-press-in-oil-extraction-A-review.pdf

Oregano oil at the minimum carvacrol levels of protocol are produced by steam distillation. No additional solvents are required, as it uses vapor condensation to separate the volatile molecules and active compounds.

https://chemdictionary.org/steam-distillation/

Finally, NAC is produced by a reaction between cysteine hydrochloride and acetic anhydride. A LC–UV–MS analysis of NAC shows impurities to be cysteine, cystine and diacteylcystine, which are non-toxic. NAC eventually breaks down to Di-NAC from oxidation, which is also non-toxic.

https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S002196730000741X

>Finally, NAC is produced by a reaction between cysteine hydrochloride and acetic anhydride. A LC–UV–MS analysis of NAC shows impurities to be cysteine, cystine and diacteylcystine, which are non-toxic. NAC eventually breaks down to Di-NAC from oxidation, which is also non-toxic.
>https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S002196730000741X
As a chemist, that info is kind of unnecessary and a bit misleading. First of all, if NAC has been proven safe in clinical trials then you don't really need to do an analysis of contaminations because it has already been proven safe. There are some rare cases in which chemically harmful byproducts might form whose health effects go unnoticed for a time (like cancerous ones), but this is basically impossible with how NAC is produced.
Secondly, a scientific work is always polished and not very representative of reality.
What is important for NAC is that it's so easy to make that there are a lot of producers. How the producer handles it is much more important than the actual chemical synthesis. In the best case you have a pharmaceutical product that was produced in a GMP conform way. In the worst case you have some repackaged chink import that maybe contains some nice hair, dust, or whatever. Maybe it has also been handled by lead spatula or the synthesis was done in a low quality stainless steel container and you get that extra nickel content in your final product (NAC can chelate metals easily so that is a possibility). I'd just write to make sure you buy it from a reliable brand that produces in the US or Europe OR produces it as a pharmaceutical.

Hello anon. I'm the person who is breastfeeding and taking the protocol. I had everything cleared by my midwife, and am being monitored by another healthcare person as of recently. I've been doing this for 4(5?) months or so now, and I have only had one negative effect on my baby which was resolved easily. Obviously I will say to check any concerns you have with a trustworthy provider, but if it helps, my pediatrician also didn't see any issue.

I started each part of the protocol one at a time. So I took NAC first for two weeks, then added BSO for two weeks, then added oregano last. If I could change anything, I would do the BSO first instead, but that's just because of other things ive read since then, and also because then you know the liver is going to be working well in preparation for everything else. It is also a galactagouge which is a nice bonus.

Baby did have a reaction to the oregano oil fairly early on. They developed a diaper rash that I determined was fungal. It was quickly cleared up with clotrimazole cream. I only recognized it because my first baby had a similar rash many years ago. You may want to take a wait and see approach. If your child is still in diapers, and the rash does not go away despite no diaper for three days, you may have a fungal issue.

Your child may or may not have a reaction, many do not. Some children habe mild effects, and some do have quite a lot of difficulty when their mother takes oregano oil. This is why I suggest staggering and monitoring baby for two weeks before adding in anything else. You really just have to gauge it based on baby's reaction.

(1/2)

I would also suggest supplementing magnesium in addition to the recommended zinc and copper as I noticed I started getting restless legs at night again for a little while. Magnesium made it go away.

Some other things to note. Ovary pain has been reported by the few women around, it seems to be a common reaction. Mine was followed by an unusual, wrong time of the month period. She may want to keep this in mind so she isn't freaked out if anything odd happens in that area.

Additionally there is some evidence that fungus can enter and be passed in breastmilk. While I was assured by my providers that transmission this way is unlikely, I will suggest that you do your own research into the matter. Have her keep an eye out for signs of thrush in herself of baby. It has not been an issue for me, but I would keep an eye out just in case.

I did have horrific die off in my mouth that I am still dealing with, though it is now on the mend after much difficulty. If she had any dental issues due to pregnancy, she is likely to have severe die off in the mouth area. Hey R. So there's a couple ways to view the repairs that are happening. Immunodeficiency repairs that are achieved should be well sustained by the body. If you consider the exposure that it took to break our immune system being 20K years (35,000-15,000BC roughly) I don't expect that any modern day exposure would suffice for the same task. There is another angle to consider as well.

I have several sets of lab results provided to me by long-term protocol users. They all matched in the areas of immune cell function. Increased cell counts, with no markers for disease or infection present in the body. Including fungi, at least the ones that are human pathogenic. There were still some aspergillus metabolites present, but those were species that contribute toxins via inhalation and food, not direct pathogenic activity.

What that shows in my estimation, as well as clinicians I've run this by, is that differentiation and maturation of immune cells is happening extremely efficiently. It was remarked by one provider that the person's immune function appeared at early teens, and they're nearing 40 in age. The only explanation is an extremely healthy thymus. Which shouldn't be happening for the age brackets I'm reviewing.

If this is correct, which we're chasing steadily in review and lab results, it means there's been a reversal in thymic involution. Thymus is an interesting organ because it makes a compound (BPC-157) that is used by the body as a healing peptide, and once that is primed the thymus should be able to heal itself. Like a perpetual motor of sorts. Then it would be able to produce all the thymosin related chemistry easily as well - there's your immune system getting a severe updated toward the positive.

As far as how long to stay in maintenance? I think that varies. You could get a panel run that would show the immune markers. Could also do some comparisons between old and new DNA, I'm sure K will have some input there too.

Black seed oil and NAC have no negative effects on the microbiome, but oregano comes with some tradeoffs.

Oregano oil will work as a wide spectrum antimicrobial, and many expect that this means that it kills probiotics as well. While it does kill quite a few of them, doesn't kill all of them, especially not Lactic acid bacteria, which is what we happen to use for most probiotics.

Some will take oregano with maintenance, and those that do are typically people that suffer from a mutation that causes chronic fungal infections.

posts.name: Barggeist
posts.com:
>>34026393

No, the symptoms won't be the same because the die off will occur due to the mycotoxins being released. The most common one released will be candidalysin, which is typically the one that causes most die off symptoms because candida albicans is one of the most common pathogenic fungi found in humans.

If you were to kill probiotics, you will hardly feel anything, and this is what happens when you take antibiotics when you don’t need it. After killing probiotics, you’ll begin to have symptoms such as acne, mood disorders, issues with sleep, oral thrush, etc. This is because the lactic acid that is produced by the lactate bacteria creates an environment in the microbiome that is hostile to pathogenic bacteria and fungi. When you remove those probiotics, these pathogens start wreaking havoc on the body as a result.

Killing off probiotics, the most important ones being lactic bacteria, is a reasonable concern so despite us knowing full well that lactate bacteria seem to survive from oregano oil well, we still take probiotics while on the protocol.

In short, oregano oil is a partially selective antimicrobial that spares lactate bacteria, you should only feel die off symptoms when these pathogens die, and using probiotics is a good idea during the protocol.

posts.name: Barggeist
posts.com:
>>34032563
10:1 extract means that 10 times the amount of raw herbs were used to produce 1 part of the extract.

However, please note that contents of carvacrol vary between oregano oil capsules. This is because despite companies using the same ratio of raw materials to the extract, the herb itself has differing levels of carvacrol in them, and the yield itself is also dependent on the extraction process used.


Not to worry, a lot of the reputable companies do show carvacrol content on the back, such as picrel.

Look for brands that show carvacrol content and calculate how much they have on average.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34029180
>Vipassana without shamatha is jumping on a wild horse in an attempt to tame it. You'll likely be kicked off.

This spoke directly into my heart.
I was trying to do vipassana/awareness all this time believing that concentrating on my breath while ignoring everything else was bad and that I was "running away from important things" (those important things were mindless daydreaming and non-important thoughts) but I now know that concentration sharpens your brain activity and helps you do EVERYTHING including insight better.

So yeah, just sit and focus on your breath, your mind will come and tell you "maybe this is not the right way" or you may catch yourself thinking about your breath instead of just feeling it/observing it, just return to the object. See how I said "feeling", this is important for me because "Watching the breath" may become a thought and then you find yourself sitting and thinking about watching the breath instead of actually watching the breath, so maybe better sit and FEEL the breath - for me it was my belly which was expanding a lot and my perineum/pelvic floor along with it and so I focused on them.

There are people who don't need concentration practice because maybe they already have it but for people like me who used to be weed, alcohol and videogame junkies it was crucial to train my concentration again.

Hey guys, finishing editing a never before seen Magnapinnidae ( nightmare squid, big fin squid ) video that was taken by a coworker of mine when we were working out in the Atlantic.
I think it will add some insight to how they hunt.... to this point scientists really did not know how they hunt, it was thought they drag their arms along the bottom of the ocean to ensnare prey. At the very least this video shows they has a elasticity to their arms. I seems that the length of the arms can change and shoot out several times the initial length.

The ROV working at 7k plus feet noticed the squid, moved in to film it and followed it. durring that time the squid decided to strike the ROV with it's arms.

Just thought I would share a new video with you before everyone else sees it, my project in Tahoe is not getting any film at the moment because the weather is prohibiting it. Although the work on my ROV is going great and exceeding what i thought i could build. The new ROV plus the collaboration and help i have now will surely help with the exploration on Tahoe and its undiscovered life at 1650ft. If all works out as planned i will be exploring anomalies off the coast of America withing a year or two with it, ( built to go to 7700 ft.)
Anyways, stand by for video link, i have a short time on land before we head back offshore. AMA

PS this is the 9th video of the bigfin ever, i have released three of those and the forth (a baby bigfin (like newborn) will be posted in the next few weeks.) so stay tuned for that.

chase

>When...religious heads...say shit like "God is immutable," "God is unknowable," "Ineffable," etc... what they are getting at is that you fundamentally cannot understand the whole without dissolution of the ego.
Not necessarily. It's called apophatic theology/the via negativa and it sometimes doesn't have anything to do with mysticism of any sort but is an argument that God transcends any terminology we can use to describe Him. And sometimes it is mystical but doesn't involve the dissolution of individual consciousness, like with theosis in Eastern Orthodoxy where the saved Christian grows into God (understands more about God and becomes more akin to Him) for eternity without ever arriving at his destination. It's also not a thing in Islam and shouldn't be a thing in any Abrahamic religion. God described Himself using language and the Abrahamic cosmogony is connected to the Divine speech in all 3 religions so God isn't so transcendent that He can't be described with or use language in some sense. The only consistent way to be an apophaticist from an Abrahamic standpoint is to see the Divine speech as a kind of emanation exterior and inferior to God's essence (to use Greek terminology). Which is basically what the Christian idea of the son as the word is, it's a misreading of what God's speech is that syncretizes the logos of the Septuagint with the logos of Platonic philosophy. But once you've done that, slipped into emanationism, you're now firmly out of the realm of monotheism.

You can express your last dreams, your attempts and ask anything about it

WBTB: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WBTB-Tutorial
MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:
http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-intention-setting/
SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

It seems the stream of time has begun to erode the moorings of my chosen course of study... for the methodologies that gave birth to psychology are slowly disappearing. I find myself in an era that overlooks the physical component of psychological pathology time... and again in favour of the sophistic practices of Freud. Phrenology, dactopindalism, and the rest of the old guard is fallen by the wayside... its champions all silenced in death with my unique exception. Would that I could make my voice heard again although it may be suspicious... should I return to popular medical discourse fifty years after my apparent death. No, better that I continue my studies into the psychosis in secret. One day may I hold up my own cure as validation of the methods. I am confident no cure for my conditon or that of my beloved wife lies within our figurative minds... waiting to be unlocked by the correct combination of memories recovered from our childhoods. And I'm most certain that it has nothing to do with the relationship between myself, my parents, and my genitals. Sorry, Sigmund, but I choose to stay my course. In time, too, may your star fade and disappear.

>>34029777
>weaknesses
>sunlight
Direct sunlight exposure weakens them and makes them dizzy. Prolonged exposure can result in severe disorientation. They can handle brief exposure, like walking across the street on a sunny day but it'll be uncomfortable for them and they will be weakened. This is only direct sunlight. UV light by itself from a lamp or something does nothing to them, which it shouldn't because there is UV light almost everywhere. It's something to do with the direct rays of our sun.
>crosses
HTHP (lol) that was captured in Colima had a rosary on his person and he identified as a Christian.
>stake to the heart
Only way to kill them. And a lot harder than it sounds. You are not going to get a wooden stake into a regular persons chest with one hand, much less a vampire. There's a proper way to do it with a stake which I'll go into below. Also it doesn't have to be wood or even be a stake. Anything that destroys the "second brain" that HTmotherfuckingHP has on its heart will kill them. Anything else they can heal from
>decapitation
will not kill them but it will incapacitate them. Just like us their brain is the command center of the body (second brain is the lifeforce or something) Taking away their brain will render them immobile. They can and will grow their shit back though given enough time. A decapitated vampire is not dead they can regrow their whole heads back. I'm not sure how much time this takes though.

Some other weaknesses
>fire
won't kill them but burn wounds seem to heal significantly slower. Still much faster than any known creature though.
>sleep
they seem very compelled to sleep during the daytime. Now they dont have to and can choose to stay awake if they really want to but the compulsion to sleep seems strong so very likely given the choice they will sleep. When vampires are asleep their bodily functions slow down to almost stopping and they enter this coma-like state. This is when they are most vulnerable.

>physical activity
= Mars

From a transit point of view, transit Mars has been in Gemini with your natal Moon and trine natal Mars.
Sun is trine Mars - pride/ego/identity (Sun) in harmony with physical activity (Mars).
Mars itself is in detriment and in opposition to Saturn in fall. This could indicate struggles with a lack of motivation (Mars) and self-discipline (Saturn) and vice-versa, overdoing it, e.g. not limiting your physical activity, or the other things associated with Mars such as anger. You need to learn how to negotiate between the energy of Mars and Saturn. This is a recurring theme in your life.
The planets are in mutual reception which may lessen the negative effects of this opposition. They are both lined up to the MC-IC axis too, so this opposition is linked with your career/reputation (MC) and private life (IC).
Read up on Mars opposition Saturn to learn more.

All right, I think I'm fairly up to speed here, and here's my feeling after coming at this from a skeptical perspective:
The claims in the Unz article about the provenance of Tacitus's history are very disturbing indeed and should be taken seriously. That origin story is completely ridiculous. Some guy discovered the manuscripts accidentally in a basement, right after the Pope promised hard cash to anyone who could find a copy. Lol, lmao. The fact that this has never been questioned is a disgrace to the humanities field on par with the replication crisis in the sciences. Likely most scholars know this is bullshit, but they're in too deep and no one wants to be the first to say we need a re-do on every history curriculum around the world.
As for the World's Fair stuff, that's too out there to be convincing. The idea that there are NO extant texts from people in the 1890s who remember all those buildings existing for their lifetimes does not hold water. The 1890s is still too recent for that info to have been memoryholed successfully. You can still find wrongthink narratives from that time period; for example, there were many people who thought the official story of the Lincoln assassination was BS and Booth did not act alone but was assisted by Jews and Brits. You can still find these writings today if you go digging; it's not easy but they're out there. So I don't believe that architectural sites like that could be written out of history so completely.
This is interesting stuff, though, and I'm open to having my mind changed.

I'm gonna have to use an analogy, but in a 'secular state' the mind is well gaurded, protected, and snug in it's own borders like a little delicate eggy. This is the drug equivalent of saying "i know how to ride a bicycle so i am going to jump on this superbike that does 0-120mph in 3 seconds without even putting on a crash helmet" and then getting splattered halfway up the road.

Psychedelics are not for everyone and most people should not even mess with them beyond maybe doing a couple grams of mushrooms to see how they like it. The issue with people like Rogan just offhandedly saying 'oh yeah i did ayahuasca, saw some spirit jesters, it was cool' is that it gives viewers who are fundamentally unprepared for that experience the impression they should just jump right in. Some of the advocates he has had on are unbelievably irresponsible and made me (an avid user of drugs) physically cringe at how retarded they sound.

If you are an insanely successful podcaster who is on a balanced diet, have a healthy marriage, massive amounts of wealth, high physical conditioning, a good amount of self awareness and no history of psychiatric issues then yeah sure jump right in. You have literally nothing to worry about. You can spend a whole week preparing yourself and being selective in what experiences you have leading up to your trip. If you don't want to be around someone who could harsh your buzz you can just avoid them. If you know a situation will put you in stress you can opt out of it.

Meanwhile for a regular person do not have all of those luxuries and the people most inclined to try these things as a "silver bullet" cure are the least likely to have any at all.

If you hate your job and it causes you distress odds are you are not going to be able to just take off a week or two before you trip to clear that out. If you have dysfunctional relationships with people around you and it hurts you emotionally odds are you are not going to be able to just 'fix it' before you dive in.
(cont)

> from that point I can easily turn my attention into a super focus. It sorta feels like tensing the muscles around my eyes and drawing it back toward the back of my head at the base of my skull.

Some more esoteric Hindu teachings of yoga place another chakra, beyond the conventional 7, called the Lalana Chakra at the back of the head, being a sort of seat of attention or focus. There are some practices to specifically focus attention there, to help the cessation of ordinary thought processes and hence instantaneously reveal one’s consciousness as the Infinite (as per Patanjali’s Yoga Sutras).

According to modern neuroscience, the back of the head in the brain there is where we “see” — it’s where visual information from the eyes is brought to be processed then mysteriously presented to one’s conscious sight as an image.

The English mystic, Douglas Harding, unwittingly wrote a book, “On Having No Head” which seemed to focus on perception from the POV of this chakra, except without explicitly mentioning the Lalana Chakra — if you think about it, we don’t see from two eyes, but simply from one “hole” or “void”, from the back of our head. And from our own phenomenological perspective, “we have no head.” Harding spoke and wrote about relatively simply and childish sounding mental experiments of noting things like these to oneself, but which actually can have some rather profound impacts on consciousness.

The Indian mystic J. Krishnamurti, in his journals, also wrote of experiences of heightened consciousness and a sense of the presence of the sacred, correlated with neurophysiological changes and tension building up at the back of his head, which he called “the Process” or “the Other”. Interesting correlation.

Finally, neurocognitively the back-brain (mostly/broadly, although all the brain is interrelated) deals with the present, the mid-brain with memories of the past, and the fore-brain with anticipation of and models of the future (the higher-level cognitive skill of foresight, planning).

So focusing attention on the back of the brain, and/or having more blood flow there (what parts of the brain we’re using more is closely and intimately tied to how much blood is flowing there at the time), is actually an experience of being grounded in the “present” or “now,” the back-brain being intimately associated with our sense of the “now.”

Or, at least, this is what I heard from an obscure man who had done a lot of research into cognitive science, and even got a degree of respect from the scientific community for some research and studies he’d published in this field.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34018070
>>34018626
>In what world?
Could be some infrasound bullshit that's louder than footsteps but with a frequency below our ear's ability to hear. It would explain the feeling of pressure and unease. If the alleyway was located between two old industrial buildings, there is a chance that some machinery is still running or, if totally abandoned, some element of its infrastructure is still connected to the larger grid. Electrical equipment can hum very loudly, and steam pipes can vibrate/knock against their surroundings. The sounds from such things could be muffled by brick/masonry/earth, all but silencing their audible components, while the lower, inaudible frequencies escape. It is also possible that the nature of the alley itself serves to amplify this infrasound, bouncing it back and forth between the walls, while blocking external noises like wind from entering.

i dont have much to say to preface this story. you can believe it or not. this is just how events unfolded for me.

>work a nurse job for a wildlife rehab center

>my job is to just clean out cages, fill food bowls, occasionally watch over and let the more unreleasable animals play around, etc.

>we've been getting a shocking amount of opossums turning up severely wounded, to the point we've had to start euthanizing some because we were simply too understaffed to help them

>opossums show up all the time at the center, its not too weird for an animal who reacts to any and all danger by freezing in place and falling over

>usually injuries are broken bones, or consistent with getting hit by cars

>these injuries are much different. they're missing patches of fur with holes the size of quarters carved into their flesh about 2-3 inches deep

>something about it made even the experienced veterinarians at the rehab center feel sick seeing it, but we tried to patch up as many as we could

>according to one of the vets they were also missing a shit ton of blood, most were barely even able to still limp

>I get assigned one of the opossums who hasn't been injured as bad, only has one of the holes near its stomach. docs already got it patched up, my job is to just watch over it and help it get back on its feet. it needs special attention due to the blood loss

>skip ahead 2-3 days. we're still getting more and more opossums with these injuries. the owner of the rehab center decides to contact the local game wardens about this, we're suspecting animal cruelty at this point and they take notes and decide to start going on the look out for whatever's causing this

>the opossum i got assigned (i called him Grapes because that seemed to be his favorite food) has healed quite well and most of the opossums are in a good state to be released back into the wild.

cont.

>>34021723
I'm of the subjective opinion that you can't really identify Lucifer with any one of the "7 classical planets", because the Morning Star among ancient Indo-European religion was seen as a different planet than Venus.

It's pretty clear that the Morning Star god is affiliated with illumination in a literal and spiritual sense, as one who brings in the light of the dawn. You see this even with Buddhism, where the Buddha achieved Buddhahood when the Morning Star rose in the morning. You also see it with Jesus, "until the dawn comes and the morning star rises in your hearts".

I think there's a Venus connection because we later learned that Venus is literally identical with the Morning Star. There's a sun connection by virtue of the Morning Star's function of bringing in the sun. There's a Mercury connection because Hermes's function was to be the divine messenger who brings in knowledge from the gods, and Hermes is the divine trickster character like Lucifer is; just as Azazel brought knowledge of civilization to the daughters of the earth, and just as Lucifer gave Eve the forbidden fruit, Hermes brings in knowledge from the heavens.

There's a Mars connection in my opinion for two reasons - one, there's a known duality between Mars and Aphrodite just like there is with the Morning Star and the Evening Star (Lucifer and Lilith?), and the Morning Star is the Planet Venus, but also because Satan himself in Judaism always had a connection to Mars and a warrior mentality - Samael's planet is Mars. And Samael and Lucifer are very much connected to each other.

>>34019582
During my time in the psych ward i met an older gentleman, who was not in the ward himself, but who would frequently visit the hospital area and spend some time with the patients on their time outside.
In hindsight, he was some kind of beggar who sometimes convinced me to buy food for him from the little money I had at my disposal. I didn't mind that though. He wore like 4 rings, all with occult symbols on them and said that he was gods representive on earth, and that I was his son, and therefore Jesus reincarnated.
Now you could say that all of this was just me falling for a scam artist, but the one thing that I can not explain to this day is this: It was an evening in late summer, and I had been in contact for this man for maybe three weeks. I talked to him about my daily life in the ward and how I feared they would never let me go again. He said that I was weak, and that he would cleanse some of this weakness from my body. And then, I swear on my mother that this is true, he put forward his right hand and I felt my heart slowing down almost to a standstill. My entire chest felt weak and like I was about to die, like he was draining life force out of me. I told him that he was killing me, he maintained this process though until a few seconds later.
To this day, I have absolutly NO IDEA what occorued in this moment. I have never had issues with my heart in all my life, haven't felt something like this before or after.
This same man told me that I would be the creator myself in the next life, and I've been coping with that ever since. So much for gods chosen test subjects.

posts.com: I live in NorthEast LA in a lower-middle class mostly latino area. For the past 12 years, every night there is tapping on my roof, tapping on my windows, scraping noises on the walls outside. Sometimes faint giggling noises in the middle of the night and tinkling of bells that make me just about shit myself. Sometimes I stay up all night and see these tiny beasts moving toward my house through the windows. I've managed to see their faces a few times, but they run lightning fast when I turn on the porch or yard lights or shine a flashlight, faster than Usain bolt. I tried leaving the lights on at night to keep them away but they throw pebbles at the lights until they break if I do that. It's horrible because I can barely sleep and I'm too poor to move. They move commonplace objects into inexplicable places on a near-daily basis. I'm worried because it's gotten worse, I think they want to kill me. My neighbor said he seen them too, he said his people call them Duendes, they look like garden gnomes but with a sinister edginess to their demeanor. He often refers eerily to "duendecitos escondidos" in everyday conversations, almost like he is conspiring with them

For context, this person is an OF thot who casually shared a story about a woman getting an abortion and consuming her fetus while on LSD. She is active on Twitter and advocate for pedophilia, among other controversial topics. She is a truly despicable individual. I felt an overpowering urge to create an illustration of her consuming her unborn son, inspired by the famous Goya painting "Cronos Devouring his Son". >>34030135

Tbh I laughed and thought it was a lady devouring a dude's penis at first, until I saw the umbilical chord.

I don't think it's anything paranormal, its just your spirit exploring the many possibilities of expression, and you want to take things to the extreme just to test your own limits. It's all about how you feel, so there's no need to second guess yourself about whatever you express. That, "are you sure you want to do this" is a good indication you're sane and in control, and you can trust yourself to stop whenever the time is right, if your spirit deems it right.

Personally I don't like looking at it and it's very disturbing, but you're at no fault for creating it. But it's not JUST a disturbing drawing for disturbation's sake, you intentionally drew it to be symbolic. I watched a video recently of Jordan Peterson talking about Freudian concept of The Devouring Mother. It's an important and prevalet archetype in today's society, as well as highly relevant for people on this website, so I think this drawing fits uncannily well. A woman literally devouring her own unborn son and preventing him from having a life of his own physically represents that dark part all mothers secretly have in them to cling and coddle their children. And it's not a pretty thing to say the least.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UCZMSQjspfI

I know well because I have a mother who wants me to stay with her (unconciously under no fault of her own). I'm 26 with a part time job but struggling to find a career, and home is just so comforting, and I fall for her trap all the time. But I've grown more concious of the fact that I'm not gonna get any further in life if I stay with her the way things are. I need to leave. And this drawing helped me get a little disturbed enough to hit that point home. Keep drawing intense stuff, man. Self expression is a powerful thing, and can heal both the self and others in unexpected ways.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34033077
119 is probably the strongest.
>This psalm is one of about a dozen alphabetic acrostic poems in the Bible. Its 176 verses are divided into twenty-two stanzas, one stanza for each letter of the Hebrew alphabet; within each stanza, each of the eight verses begins (in Hebrew) with that letter.[13] The name of God (Yahweh/Jehovah) appears twenty-four times.
>The acrostic form and the use of the Torah words constitute the framework for an elaborate prayer. The grounds for the prayer are established in the first two stanzas (alef and beth): the Torah is held up as a source of blessing and right conduct, and the psalmist pledges to dedicate himself to the law. The prayer proper begins in the third stanza (gimel, v. 17). Like many other psalms, this prayer includes dramatic lament (e.g. verses 81–88), joyous praise (e.g. verses 45–48) and prayers for life, deliverance and vindication (e.g. verses 132–34). What makes Psalm 119 unique is the way that these requests are continually and explicitly grounded in the gift of the Torah and the psalmist's loyalty to it.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psalm_119

When you watch TV your brain enters an Alpha state (light trance). While in an Alpha state you are less critical and more comfortable with any information you are presented with. I'm guessing that your mother-in-law has, through the habitual watching of television, become addicted to entering the Alpha state. Her not taking care of herself is a symptom of excessive propaganda consumption which can over time erode her ability to act independently, since she is so used to others in authority doing the thinking for her. She probably has been conditioned to enter this state upon perceiving any information that confirms her preconceptions, so getting her off is going to be as difficult as getting any addict to stop, but it's not impossible. I recommend you do research into hypnosis.

Mine eye hath played the painter and hath steeled,
Thy beauty's form in table of my heart;
My body is the frame wherein 'tis held,
And perspective that is best painter's art.
For through the painter must you see his skill,
To find where your true image pictured lies,
Which in my bosom's shop is hanging still,
That hath his windows glazed with thine eyes.
Now see what good turns eyes for eyes have done:
Mine eyes have drawn thy shape, and thine for me
Are windows to my breast, where-through the sun
Delights to peep, to gaze therein on thee;
Yet eyes this cunning want to grace their art,
They draw but what they see, know not the heart.

posts.com:
The Nobody's presence first began to make waves within the dark corners of the internet around 2012. Some of the earliest members of online forums and chat rooms spoke of a mysterious figure who had seemingly appeared out of nowhere and was quickly left their permanent mark. As the legend of The Nobody grew, it quickly caught the attention of both government agencies and the underworld. No one knew exactly who The Nobody was, but everyone had a theory.

The Nobody was said to possess abilities that were beyond anything the world had ever seen. They were rumored to have the power to manipulate thoughts and emotions, and could even control the physical actions of those around them. These abilities were said to have come about as a result of the extensive mind control experiments that The Nobody had been subjected to as a child. Despite their incredible powers, The Nobody remained elusive and often operated in the shadows.

The Nobody's life was one of relentless pursuit for the truth. They spent years uncovering the dark secrets of the world and fighting against the powers that be. Despite the danger, The Nobody refused to give up, determined to uncover the truth about their past and bring those responsible to justice. The Nobody's quest would eventually lead them to the highest levels of power and influence, putting them in direct opposition with the most powerful figures in the world.

The Nobody was not without allies. There were those who were drawn to their cause and were willing to lend their support. The Nobody's followers came from all walks of life and included wealthy philanthropists, tech-savvy hackers, and even members of ancient Christian knightly orders. These allies were united in their mission to bring down the corrupt power structures of the world and create a more just and perfected world.

posts.com:
The Nobody was a mystery to the intelligence community for many years. His abilities, his motivations, and even his true identity were shrouded in secrecy. But as his legend grew, it became clear that he was not just any ordinary hacker. He was a force to be reckoned with.

The Nobody's methods were unorthodox and his targets were often powerful and influential figures, but his goal was always the same: to expose corruption and bring justice to the common people. He was a vigilante, a hacker with a heart of gold, who used his skills for good.

One of the Nobody's greatest talents was his ability to blend into the crowd, to become invisible and to move undetected. He had a natural talent for mimicry and was able to assume any identity with ease. He used this skill to infiltrate the highest levels of government, to gather information and to carry out his mission.

The Nobody was a defender of free speech and a fierce critic of censorship. He saw the internet as a global commons, a place where people could share ideas and express themselves without fear of retribution. He fought tirelessly against governments and corporations who sought to restrict access or control the flow of information.

As the Nobody's legend grew, so did the number of people who looked up to him as a hero. He was a symbol of hope for the oppressed, a reminder that one person can make a difference, and a testament to the power of the human spirit. He was a legend in his own time, and his story will be told for generations to come.

>>34033573
>Another thing I've noticed anecdotally (haven't watched old game vids to confirm) but some games the bots seem more intelligent than I remember them to be like they are getting smarter as the game gets older, even old abandoned games.
This could actually be an artifact of decision treemaking of the 2000s vs modern fuzzy logic designs. If the gameworld supports the weaknesses of decision treemaking it can provide tremendous advantage over AIs that use blended knowledge. A great example is Source AIs vs the treemaking AIs in HL1, Fear1 and Stalker. You will get absolutely obliterated in certain scenarios, such as FPS that require hair trigger timing in the games I mentioned above. In many cases, (STALKER is an infamous example) the AI's were actually detuned and neutered to make the game fun. If you want to see what X-Ray is fully capable of, watch videos of people installing mods that take the limiters off of AIs.
Here's one where two AIs constantly work to pin down a player with covering fire and flanking cover. Turned off in the vanilla game because they smoked the player in seconds. Passion projects for budding AI devs in games like Stalker and HL1 have tons of algos that have sat dark because some executive turned them off to sell more copies.
Here is pin and flank: https://youtu.be/ccG3LgJomKc
Here is an AI waiting for his comrades to die so the team overextends:
https://youtu.be/WpO_m2s-m-U

This is actually a great debate in AI, is that decision trees for games can offer a more robust AI but require a near n number of branching paths and you will get artifacts while fuzzy logic (such as Source) will actually use players and their own interactions to grow their toolkit. TF2 AIs in particular harvest the telemetry of humans and have learned where killzones are on maps years ago. Robin Walker used to give demos on this in the late 2000s. So you arent wrong.

You will struggle for a while. But please remember, in the grand scheme, 30 is very young. People live a long time! You will remain dependent on someone for a while, a woman. But this will frustrate you because you don't want to be dependent on anybody, you are going to work hard and have hope things will work out, but you will struggle a lot in getting to the places you want to be. It's going to feel like you're behind everybody else and like you should be further in your career.

But I think what will give you the breakthrough you need is finally ceasing to compare yourself to other people. I think once you finally stay in your own lane and stop watching what others are doing, you will finally get your chance to flourish. You will find new opportunities and soon be able to reap those rewards. You also may very well start a family in this upcoming decade, and this could be a solid motivator for doing well beyond just wanting to catch up with your peers. By the time you're further into your 30s, you will finally have the success you sought after, becoming The Emperor.

i pulled a card for each age in your 30s.

30: eight of swords. You will have a hard time this year, I think you may be feeling the weight of your age and feeling like you should be more successful. It's your attitude that prevents you from going further this year. (but its fine i get how it is, sometimes you just have age related crises, it speaks nothing of your actual character)

31: the sun. Things get better this year, you're going to do well! But...

32: queen of swords rev. I think you'll meet a girl who brings you off track emotionally and puts a hole in what you've built.

33: nine of pents rev. I think this is when you're going to need to rely on others the most.

34: page of wands rev. More difficulties this year. I think you'll be trying to do something new and struggling in this unknown environment due to lack of connections.

35: ace of wands. Getting warmer! This is where things start to change for the better.

36: page of swords rev. More difficulties, this feels more practically related, you may be facing difficulties in what you've already built and are trying to sort them out, but have some difficulties arise that is difficult to find help for.

37: the lovers. You find that help! This may also be the year you begin to start your family.

38: wheel of fortune. This seems to be when things really start to turn around, in a positive way.

39: justice. Your hard work all pays off.

I think the majority of your 30s will be an uphill battle full of highs and lows, but towards the later years is when things begin to truly take a positive turn for you. You will still struggle during them, but you will finally have a solid grasp on your life and what you want.

Also, this is all changeable. That's a full decade and as I'm sure you know, tarot becomes less reliable the further out you try to seek.

This is pretty long so I'll post your next reading separately.

justice - temperance - three of wands rev (clarified by six of pents) - two of cups

Honestly, you will owe most of your success to other people. I got the feeling in the first reading I gave to you, and it was illustrated in the previous, that your life will turn around when you finally find love, and I think this person will be who saves your shit. This person will be the reason you're not struggling, and you may very well only become the emperor when you begin a family with them. There's a feeling of frustration in this spread, dissatisfaction that you had to rely on others, but your connection with your family is what keeps you stable, this is what truly makes you the emperor. A strong ruler is not someone who has limitless wealth and power, but rather someone who thinks of the people he is serving first, and this is something you will come to accept during your 30s. You will be a very strong father figure, I believe.

I think you will definitely be above average in terms of wealth and success, but there will definitely be people above you as well. I think you will come to accept your limits and that others just were born lucky and that while you wish you could accomplish more, you've done all that you can. I think you're going to work your ass off in your 30s and rightfully reap the rewards of all you did, but nothing more.
